guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for pantoprazole and CYP2C19

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily C member 19

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299212

text.html: NO action is required for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: The higher plasma concentration of pantoprazole results in an increase in the therapeutic effectiveness, without an increase in the side effects.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299215

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for pantoprazole in normal metabolizers.

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of a normal metabolizer phenotype on pantoprazole.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299213

text.html: NO action is required for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: The higher plasma concentration of pantoprazole results in an increase in the therapeutic effectiveness, without an increase in the side effects.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299214

text.html: For Helicobacter pylori ERADICATION THERAPY: 1. use a 5-fold higher dose. 2. advise the patient to contact their doctor if symptoms of dyspepsia persist. OTHER INDICATIONS: 1. be alert to reduced effectiveness. 2. if necessary, use a 5-fold higher dose. 3. advise the patient to report persisting symptoms of dyspepsia.

implications: The genetic variation may lead to a reduced pantoprazole plasma concentration and therefore reduced pantoprazole effectiveness.

citations.title: Pharmacogenetics: from bench to byte--an update of guidelines.
authors: Rongen G A P J M
